## What is a question?
A question is one of the most important things that you can use to communicate effectively. Questions are used for many different purposes, and they allow us to ask about something without having any preconceived notions or assumptions associated with it.

A is twice as old as B who was born before her brother C whose age is thrice that of Dโs. Now find out whether it possible for all four persons to have different ages.

#### Solution:

The number of ways in which a group can be formed by choosing any two from $n$ objects is given by $\frac{n(n-1)}{2}$.
Hence there are three possibilities where n = 5.
(i) One person has an even age,
(ii) Two people have even ages while one has odd age or vice versa and
(iii) All of them have odd ages.
If we consider all possibilities then either only one person will have even age or both having even ages and one with odd age OR all should have odd ages.

## Problem Description:

Given a function `f(x)` and an integer k, find all the values of x in `[0, 100]` that satisfy `(x+1)^k== f^k(f(x))`.

Note: The value of `f(0)=0`.


Example 1.

Input: `k=7`, `function=f=x**5`.
Output:`{19}`.
Explanation: `((20)**5)-(((20-1)**5)+1)==(1999)`
So answer is `{19}`
 

Constraints:

`1 <= k <= 15`
`f(x)` should be continuous in [0, 100]
You may assume it takes O(log x) time to evaluate the expression `f(x)` for any given x.

## What is GATE?
GATE stands for Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering. It is an entrance exam conducted every year for admissions into M.E./M.Tech/Ph.D courses offered at IITs and other centrally funded technical institutes across India.
